reviews.review_msg: Unnecessarily long homework and exams. Some assignment solutions were posted the day before the final. He was always late to lecture, 15 minutes late for the final, and an hour late for our review session. Taking a class with him is a waste of money and time. Take it if you like proofs, want to teach yourself, and have a lot of spare time.

Assigns hw on Sunday afternoons and expects you to hand it in on Wednesday. Took him a couple of assignments before he finally changed the weekly deadline to Fridays. His lectures are so-so, don't expect much from him. You won't learn anything. Hws are difficult; however, some questions on exam were based on hw questions. So study the hw.

Course material was interesting and Dr. Adcock gave good lectures. Assignments were sometimes difficult but he was helpful during office hours. Midterms were tight on time but were fair if you studied the lectures and assignments. Final was very fair and even had a question pasted from one of the assignments.
His lecturing skills need improvement. He's not as intelligent as he thinks he is and has tremendous difficulty communicating simple information. Not recommended.

A few years after taking this, I still remember him as a caring lecturer. When the midterms were graded, he had a long discussion with us about common errors and things that he could do better as an instructor. His lecture slides can get dense, but he listened class feedback (giving us a summary for major topics along with practice questions).

Dr. Chauve is a caring professor. The exams were very fine and easy in comparison to lecture notes. The only problem I had was about the coding questions in assignments.  I was feeling like if those questions were not helpful because most of the codes were written by professor before, and only small parts required to complete. Thank you Dr.Chauve
His notes were useful and he was helpful with homework assignments.  Gave extensions when needed!!

Good prof.  Put alot of effort into the class.  Great marking scheme with no final.  Tests were hard, so were the assignments, but everyone seems to have gotten perfect on the project, so everything was ballanced.  Will definitely take another course with him.
Tests and assignments are very fair. I like how the course is setup with 3 tests and a term project instead of a final.
not bad, he's material is not that hard and really helpful
He is a great teacher, adn I learned more in his course than any other math course at SFU.

Im not joking hes awful. he doesnt teach at this university anymore he teaches at the university of manchester. Im sure he's a great researcher and a lovely guy but he should not be in a lecture hall has ZERO time for you out of hours literally doesnt even respond to emails. literally the bare minimum of information. calls derivative doodoodoo. ugh
Easy prof, though his notes are lacking organization and commentary, and can be hard to follow.  He is quite helpful in his office hours.

Nice course, exams are really base on examples and HWs; if u look the HW and practice, u can pass the course easily. there are also some changlle questions on each exams to pump up the marks for good students

If I could give him a 0 I would. No examples only proofs. Messy handwriting. Haven't taken a test yet but the entire class is clueless. Makes 0 sense. The textbook is garbage. Homework is not just difficult but the questions are confusing. Also removed recordings cuz ppl weren't attending but doesn't understand ppl are in different time zones
